sub_title: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist
summary:
🌟 Empowering Teams | Facilitator Extraordinaire | Driving Collective Success 🤝

🔍 About Me 🔍
I possess an array of peculiar insights spanning diverse subjects, owing to my inclination to avidly consume articles, constantly fuelling my thirst for knowledge. My broad spectrum of interests and knowledge about a myriad of topics helps me to analyze complex problems from multiple angles and solve them with creative solutions. 

In my role as an in-house service designer collaborating with various organizational departments, I guide teams and sessions through complex challenges and collaboration hurdles, fostering a customer-centric and inventive approach to problem-solving.

Working as a corporate strategist my role involves gazing ahead, researching specialized subjects, and distilling acquired insights into potential impacts on the company. Additionally, I hold the overall responsibility of interpreting how these influences should guide our actions.

💡 My Approach 💡
My design approach is grounded in empathy, a deep understanding of user needs, collaboration, and fun. I believe in putting the end-users at the heart of every project, working closely with cross-functional teams to uncover insights and co-create solutions that truly resonate.

🛠️ Skills & Expertise 🛠️
✓ Human-Centered Design: Applying design thinking methodologies to foster a culture of innovation and customer-centricity. 
✓ Meeting & Workshop Facilitation: Designing and leading engaging sessions that drive productive discussions and achieve desired objectives.
✓ User Research: Uncovering actionable insights to inform design decisions and ensure alignment with target audiences.
✓ Service Blueprinting & Journey Mapping: Visualizing end-to-end experiences to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement.
✓ Collaboration: Fostering open communication to drive consensus and project success.
✓ Process Improvement & Agile Practices: Implementing frameworks to enhance efficiency and agility in team operations.
✓ Innovation & Change Management: Fostering a culture of innovation and guiding teams through transformational change initiatives.

🌟 Impact & Success Stories 🌟
Throughout my career, I have had the privilege of facilitating transformative experiences for diverse groups in many different departments. Witnessing teams overcome obstacles and achieve breakthroughs fuels my passion for facilitation and reaffirms the potential of creative problem-solving and collective brilliance.

projects.title: Nice to meal you
projects.description:
for Lexus Design Award 2015
This project was an experiment to re-invent the experience of eating. I wanted to lay the process of eating in a new perspective in order to enrich the experience and herby evoke and attach new senses, feelings and emotions to it.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist

projects.title: Troop Diary
projects.description:
for Hans Sauer Award 2015
The goal of our social design concept is to build a cohesive and self-sustaining micro community, where people independently from their gender, language, cultural, social, ethnic, religious or political affiliation have equal rights and responsibilities. With the help of a special diary a few amount of people can share, garden and look after a little piece of land at the same time.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist
Service Design Manager at Laerdal Medical

projects.title: Citybeat – Happy City/De Gelukkige Stad
projects.description:
for Kaap Belvédére
Is that possible to make someone happy by designing a product or service only for him/her? During the course of ‘Design for emotions and subjective well-being’ by Delft Institute of Positive Design we designed a tool only for our person, Riika, instead of a group of users. Based on Riika’s talents and skills, pleasures, contributions and relations we created Citybeat, which helps her to get lost in the city while she can discover different faces of her town.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist
Lead User Researcher @ Moneybox | Research, Strategy, Team Management

projects.title: Design for the Base of the Pyramid (BOP)
projects.description: Our group focused on establishing a product development team in China, in order to expand the market for Lego in theory. After exploring the cultural, social & economical context of China we developed a conceptual idea of a new product for the local BOP for LEGO.

projects.title: Fabricator
projects.description:
Msc thesis
‘Designing a domestic product and an adherent service which can improve the quality of life and creativity of elderly people living at home‘ was one of my most complex research and design projects. My goals were to motivate elderly people for creativity and for active lifestyle and support the already active ones. Fabricator is an internet based DIY service, designed for people over 60.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist

projects.title: Mobile check in
projects.description: In the framework of ‘Usability and User eXperience Assessment in Product Design’ my team investigated the interaction with the ‘touchpoints’, the electronic gates and poles for checking in and out at the NS stations by using the OV-chipcard. We decided to put our efforts into making problems as easy to recover as possible. This project was therefore about providing a clear, effective and convenient solution for error recovery making users eventually love and trust the system despite of its faults.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist
Founder of Member Design & Bern Media
Senior Research Consultant at Ruigrok

projects.title: Solemate
projects.description: Solemate is part of an experience sampling system, designed to map out different emotions and needs while buying lunch in the IDE canteen at TU Delft. It is placed in the users shoes to measure the feeling of comfort and discomfort by sensing different body postures.

UX research & design, Product development
Senior Research Consultant at Ruigrok

projects.title: Butterfly LED TV
projects.description:
for Jász-Plasztik Kft.
Our client is a plastic part manufacturer who desired not just producing but designing their own LED televisions. Based on our research we chose to design a kitchen television, which later has been selected by the company for realization.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist
Project Manager at AImotive

projects.title: Griffin table and  relaxing furniture
projects.description:
for Demola Budapest
Demola in TU Budapest is a loft-space, where multi-disciplinary teams can collaborate. After extensive research of the future users and the usage of similar spaces, I’ve presented a relaxation furniture family and a multifunctional table, which has been selected by the client for realization.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist

projects.title: The Road of Light
projects.description:
Bsc thesis - for Kertkoktél Kft.
The goal of this project was to entice people back to Rákóczi Road, which was a popular and vivid shopping street in the 60’s, by creating a similar atmosphere with modern tools and by providing new social experience in Budapest. The project consists of interactive shop-windows, a unique pedestrian cross, gesture recognizing game and street furniture.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist

projects.title: Balanced Walking
projects.description: In the framework of The European Global Product Realization project (EGPR) - which is a joint annual project of six universities and industrial partners (UMC Utrecht, Evalan and Protospace) executed via videoconference system in 7 months – with my 9-membered team, we had the opportunity to develop a rehabilitation device for home usage which combined modern engineering solutions. The goal of the product was to measure the loads on the patient’s feet, compared them and give feedback both the patient and his doctor.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist
Senior UX Designer, Researcher & Strategist at icapps
Head of Software @ Equip.app

projects.title: Visible feelings
projects.description:
for Philips Lumalive
How can we create meaningful interactions by using LED embedded fabric in the field of ‘Theatre and Performance’? In my project the Lumalive-covered products reflect on the fineness and quality of our touch and they visualize our feelings and intentions towards them. As the objects mirror our feelings and give feedback, we get what we give, this interaction generates more and more actions between human and its environment.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist

projects.title: Liberty Global
projects.description: My team worked for 20 weeks in the Spark Innovation Lab, an open and inspirational space at a central location in the headquarters of Liberty Global in Amsterdam, and contributed to a more disruptive innovation within the company. Our assignment was based on a future need from the business and resulted in the presentation of a validated prototype.

projects.title: Circular Backpack
projects.description:
By joining the Circular Design Challenge I had a chance to create a backpack concept that shows what this particular consumer product might look like in a circular future. My concept was a service system operated by TU Delft which offers protection and comfortable transport of personal belongings and school supplies for students during their studies in a form of a leasable backpack. 
I had the honor that my project was presented at Dutch Design Week in 2016 at Drive Design Research & Innovation Festival organized by CLICKNL.

contributors.headline: Service Designer | Helping Enhance Customer Experiences | Corporate Strategist

profile_positions.description: Practicing service design leadership - embedding the mindset of service design in the daily life of my colleagues -  supporting and facilitating the process of service delivery of our teams / value chain experience design
profile_positions.title: Service Designer

profile_positions.description: With my project, I was looking for and designing applicable tools and practices for continuous customer involvement in the product development phases to improve the customer experience of the Dutch B2B market-leading service management software. To reach that goal, I combined and applied service design and strategic design approaches along with the agile mindset.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
I did freelance work such as logos, corporate images, visualizations, presentations, websites, 3D modeling and consulting.  
Working on smaller, sometimes personal projects besides my full-time activities is refreshing. It grabs me out of the world of complex problems and rewards me with instant gratification.
profile_positions.title: Independent Designer

profile_positions.description:
Circular Delft is a platform informing and supporting students in applying circular thinking. Aiming toward making the TU Delft a Dutch circular hotspot.
Promoting circular economy and bringing sustainable products and services closer to TU Delft students require lots of creative and fun ideas, as well as, coordinated and structured organization. Fortunately, I was lucky enough to be part of an enthusiastic and dedicated group of students with whom we assisted in realizing several initiative within the university.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
My team - students from all three Master's programs of Industrial Design Engineering at TU Delft (Integrated Product Design, Design for Interaction and Strategic Product Design) - worked in the Spark Innovation Lab and contributed to a more disruptive innovation within the company. 
Besides the obvious gain of the project for a design student, exploring and applying disruptive innovation through a real-life case at the world’s largest international cable company, this project aroused my curiosity to understand more the so far to me unknown territory, the B2B market.
profile_positions.title: Student Innovator

profile_positions.description:
By joining the Circular Design Challenge I had a chance to create a consumer product in combination with a service and a business model that shows what a consumer product might look like in a circular future.
This project was an eye-opener. Not just because it allowed me to gain deeper insights and understanding into the practice of circular economy, but because it strengthen my dedication to support sustainable living.
profile_positions.title: Design Student

profile_positions.description:
Working in a reputable 80 year-old furnishing family business allowed me not just to practice German, but also kept me in the closeness of design. Since they work together with the best manufacturer e.g. Vitra, Edra, Montana, Cassina, Knoll, Alessi, etc., I had the possibility to study new materials and manufacturing techniques as well as to be introduced into the world of interior architecture.
Besides my tasks such as caring of accessory and fabric department, receiving and processing goods, selling in the accessory-range and decorating the showroom, I was in daily contact with customers which facilitates to practice and improve my consulting skills.
profile_positions.title: Sales Assistant

profile_positions.description: As the official contact person of the design workshop I am responsible for communication of all the requests and information between the participants and the organizers. Whether it is arranging the invitation letter for Visa, taking care of special diets or planning the journey to Zsennye. In addition in the last two years I enjoyed practicing my mentoring and facilitating skills in small groups as  fellow team leader of Human Interaction Team.
profile_positions.title: Organizer

profile_positions.description: Just like I imagined in a small design studio: German precision, diversity in projects and tasks and hardcore product design by using the classic industrial designer toolkit: brainstorming, visualization, 3D modelling (Rhino, SolidWorks), graphical works (Adobe Creative Suite), rendering. I learned the art of communication with client and I could practice structural working style and time management skills in stressful situations.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Design Intern

profile_positions.description: EGPR  (European Global Product Realisation)  is a joint annual project of six universities and industrial partners executed via videoconference system during one semester. This course was the part of the obligatory courses in the Master Program of Industrial Design Engineer at Budapest University of Technology and Economics. I was the right hand of head of organization. I helped him planning the course and the prototyping week. Among others I was responsible for the website-updates, arranging accommodation and travelling for the participants and I was the do-all person during the prototyping week.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant of EGPR course
